website_summaries.verdict: With a rich selection of features that appeal to pros and amateurs alike, this metronome is the best available.
pros: Offers multiple functions, including a tuner and clip
Provides auditory, visual, and vibratory beats
cons: Expensive relative to the other models on our shortlist

customer_reviews.title: The sync is useful
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that two or more of these metronomes can be linked together. I actually use two of these for marching band. I can hook up one to a sound system in the back of the second hash mark and trigger it to start from the sideline. I have even triggered it to start all the way from the press box. It has multiple sounds for you to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Fu

customer_reviews.title: Metronome
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect for wearing under your clothing, and no one will ever know you are wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny R. Prater

customer_reviews.title: Good idea - not great execution.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but the pulse device is far too weak. Particularly as a drummer, it's all but non-existant. But even playing guitar, it's not enough. As a metronome, I like it, and the audio level is good, the sounds work, but you could do the same with an iPod app. Considering the price, I regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M.

customer_reviews.title: Truly Innovative Product
customer_reviews.text: This is so well designed. Like the IPhone of metronomes. It clips comfortably on the belt or pocket and is just a joy to use. The first day I got it I accompanied a 50 piece choir that tends to speed up and slow down quite a bit. With the vibrating clip I was able to hold a steady tempo and not lose a beat when pushing and pulling against the big ensemble. I am very excited about buying another one and using it in some duo gig situations.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan McMath

customer_reviews.title: These work great!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. We use them in marching band and are able to keep key members in sync with a common pulse. Great for consistency in performance without the loud annoying click!
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: My drummer has one of these and I finally decided ...
customer_reviews.text: My drummer has one of these and I finally decided to get one. Being the bass player, it's important for me to make sure I can stay in time with my drummer. I have noticed a HUGE difference in my band. It does seem a bit expensive.
customer_reviews.author: h8ed

customer_reviews.title: Good but Too Pricey
customer_reviews.text: The metronome works well but the vibrating bit needs work. It's difficult to find a good place for the vibrating bit to go (ha ha, that's not supposed to be funny). If you have a smartphone, there are apps that might work better without a wire and you could just keep it in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hart

customer_reviews.title: Simply an amazing metronome! It works very well and has many
customer_reviews.text: Simply an amazing metronome! It works very well and has many, many options, the sync feature is one of the best them!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gripp

customer_reviews.title: smoke'n deal
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great metronome and company, I own there strobo rack tuner which is also awesome,you do not need to use vibration but it does work great if you want to use it, I also love the sync.
customer_reviews.author: photo

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: No more to add. The beat is on time, and it works as advertised...I would not hesitate to recommend this Metronome.
customer_reviews.author: Smackafatty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Useing for child with TBI to help the brain train how to walk.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: It's a good metronome, not sure it's worth $100
customer_reviews.text: It's a good metronome, not sure it's worth $100. Feels a little cheap, the battery & cover that holds it in place unattach frequently which is annoying. Also, the vibration is a little weak & I'd like to be able to control the intensity
customer_reviews.author: Robert Justesen

customer_reviews.title: Great for musicians!
customer_reviews.text: This is a sophisticated instrument that does a wide spectrum of tasks; it does them without flaws and unobtrusively. It is effective for all types of music from classical to jazz.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Summers

customer_reviews.title: Poor usability
customer_reviews.text: It's really fancy with all the cool features, but to turn it off you have to hold "Store" and "Start/Stop" button at the same time for 2 seconds...huh?? How 'bout installing a fancy "On/Off" button instead?
customer_reviews.author: Laura M. Hume

customer_reviews.title: perterson body beat
customer_reviews.text: just a marvel! i thought of inventing such a product only to find that it existed. well designed and user friendly . i wish it had a tuner built in rather than just the tones, but, well, i guess you can't have everything
customer_reviews.author: john the harp man

customer_reviews.title: Good device
customer_reviews.text: I really like this device, the metronome can go very slow and it's nice. The sync function with other devices works great. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Éthier

customer_reviews.title: Peterson Body Beat
customer_reviews.text: I am an adult cello student who started this instrument in my late 50's. Until this year, I refused to use a metronome. My Korg tuner/metronome is too low for me to hear when I play and this device offers both a audio and pulse options. The screen is large, back-lit, and easy to see.
customer_reviews.author: ccbc

customer_reviews.title: Peterson BBS 1Body Beat Eries synch Metronome.
customer_reviews.text: I don;t know. It was a gift for someone else. The recipient seemed to like it. I never used it.
customer_reviews.author: M Sydavar

customer_reviews.title: Great for drummers using this tip
customer_reviews.text: Great metronome! I am a drummer and would like to address some comments posted by other drummers. The pulse is indeed a bit weak. Here's a solution: put the pulse plug in your pocket with 10 or so coins. You will feel it while playing. Highly recommended! Drummers... BUY IT
customer_reviews.author: Auto.Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life is Poor
customer_reviews.text: The battery would not hold a charge after only 1 months. The metronome is nice, but the battery takes too long to charge and it doesn't last.
customer_reviews.author: gerry

product_meta.title: Peterson Metronome (403858)
product_meta.description: Peterson Electro-Musical Products introduced the first new approach in metronome technology in decades with the original BB-1 Body Beat pulsating metronome. You can rehearse with it audibly or perform with it silently.BBS-1 Body Beat Wireless Synchronization Features: Wirelessly synchronize an unlimited number of performers Any Body Beat Sync can be a Master device or synchronized to a group of units Join an existing group of Syncs even after formation Multiple groups can perform in the same area with no interference from one group to another Wide wireless range does not rely on line of sight Use one Body Beat Sync to control another patched to the PA FCC approved ?transmits outside standard wireless audio range Synchronized units display the Master unit's settings Output for headphones or PA system Aux output switches other devices at tempo rate (Normally open contact) Attaches to mic or music stand with optional Peterson mounting clamp Backlit, high contrast LCD display Pocket-sized compact design BBS-1 Body Beat Metronome Features: Audio, Visual or Tactile delivery modes Feel the beat from the vibration clip 3 different audio choices Feel or hear a variety of subdivisions and accent patterns 10 to 280 BPM tempo range with tap tempo feature Independently selectable time signature components Wide variety of subdivisions displayed in notation format Meter-based accent patterns ( additive meters ) Store up to 99 presets Load and play MIDI tempo maps Sync to external DAW MIDI time-code Lockout panel to prevent accidental changes to settings Encoder dial for quick entry of values Built-in speaker with volume control USB rechargeable Lithium-Ion battery USB connection for MIDI and firmware updates BBS-1 Body Beat Audio Tuner Features: Full chromatic range 7 octave range Concert A pitch adjustable from 390Hz to 490Hz Built-in speaker & volume control.
feature_bullets: Audio, Visual or Tactile delivery modes
10 to 280 BPM tempo range with tap tempo feature
Load and play MIDI tempo maps

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
